listitem.para: Always use the specified IP address IPADDR.
Algorithm to use when generating an IP address. The following algorithms are available:
Use the lowest available IP in the subnet. If there is a hole in the range of IP addresses in use, this algorithm will fill the hole.
Use the highest available IP in the subnet. Repeated use means allocating the IP addresses backwards.
Use the highest IP address in use and add one. Using it repeatedly means allocating IP addresses in numerical order, but not filling any holes.
The default value for ALGO is lowest.
Choose a free IP address from the network containing IPADDR. Use the --ipalgorithm option to tell how the address should be selected from the addresses available in the network.
Choose a free IP address from the network containing FQDN. Use the --ipalgorithm option to tell how the address should be selected from the addresses available in the network.

Check the switch discovery tables and determine the network to use based on which switch port saw the MAC address of the interface. The discovery tables can be updated using the poll switch command. Use the --ipalgorithm option to tell how the address should be selected from the addresses available in the network.
